channel.title: FML Ubuntu
channel.description: Okay, in Ubuntu 11.04, when it goes into idle a screensaver pops up, but after a while it freezes. I lock my computer before I go to sleep, so, no one gets on my computer. Now, it freezes, and I have to reboot my PC to get back on; is there anyway to fix this? I host two servers on it. I heard something about disabling sync to vblank, but then things just seem weird. Any fix?

item.title: FML Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“sageofmali, post:9, topic:399644”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=496774.msg3632492#msg3632492 date=1308345265]
Check if your graphics card has know issues.
[/quote]
Does GeForce 6150SE nForce 430 have any?[/quote]
I don’t know, look?

Read full topic

item.title: FML Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:399644”][quote author=sageofmali link=topic=496774.msg3632295#msg3632295 date=1308333971]

Ubuntu forums would yield faster, more accurate responses. As far as your error goes, I had a similar issue once - I don’t recall what the problem was (it was hardware related, though).

Damn, okay.

The WM of the machine would randomly lock up and the keyboard would become unresponsive. It was VERY annoying, I ended up having a nigger-rig’d fix for it and eventually got rid of the machine because it was so much of a pain in the ass to maintain the older hardware.

My computer is somewhat new:
Ubuntu 11.04 64-bit
Kernel: 2.6.38-8-generic
AMD Athlon™ II X2 250u Processor
eMachines - ET1331G-05w
750GB HD
8GB RAM

[/quote]

Is it a laptop?[/quote]
No, Desktop.

Read full topic
